critique: This document is an executive order from 1935 related to the Trading with the Enemy Act. It grants the Attorney General power to revoke orders and reclaim properties if fraud or misrepresentation is suspected. It's difficult to place this on the traditional left-right spectrum (ideological tilt) as it deals with legal and procedural matters. It doesn't directly address immigration, so that's neutral. It expands executive power by granting the Attorney General broad authority. It doesn't clearly shift power between state and federal levels (federalism). It leans towards national security by addressing potential fraud related to the Trading with the Enemy Act. It doesn't directly regulate the economy, so that's neutral. It doesn't directly address social inclusion, so that's neutral.
